title: Administer Operations Orchestration Containerized
content:
This section provides instructions on how to administer Operations Orchestration (OO) as the suite admin and the tenant admin. 

Suite admin tasks

Perform the following tasks as the suite admin.

  1. Set up a tenant if you haven't already done so. For details, see Set up a tenant. 
  2. Deploy the OO capability on the tenant. For details, see Deploy OO Containerized capability in Suite Administration.
  3. Upload OO licenses to OO and assign OO licenses to the tenant so that DND can communicate with OO. For details, see Manage OO Central license. 

Tenant admin tasks

Perform the following tasks as the tenant admin:

  1. Set up OO so that Service Management is connected to OO and you can launch OO Central from within Service Management. For details about the setup procedure, see Set up Operations Orchestration.
  2. For users other than the tenant admin to access the OO menu items in Service Management and work with OO Central, the tenant admin needs to grant the users the required permissions in Service Management and the suite admin needs to grant them the required OO permissions. For details, see Assign role permissions to users. 
  3. OO Workflow Designer is a web-based environment for authoring flows, which is available as a standalone product that can be deployed either on a Windows or Linux server. Install the Designer so that you can author OO flows with this tool. For details, see  Install OO Workflow Designer. 
  4. OO comes with an Internal Operation Orchestration Remote Action Server (OO RAS), which is used to manage your infrastructure on SaaS. However, if you have the on-premises infrastructure to manage, you need to install external OO RAS. For details, see Install an external OO RAS.
  5. After you have installed an external OO RAS, you can set up the topology. For details, see Configure orchestration settings.
